intro: Melampyrum laxum var. arcuatum, commonly known as the bent yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, often curved stems that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellowish-orange, and arranged in clusters, with two lips that are characteristic of the Orobanchaceae family. The leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a reddish or purplish tint, especially along the veins.
